DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effect placement power AcrySof Toric post-operative visual acuity spectacle independence distance vision . This determine compare manifest refraction pre-operatively post-operatively evaluate rotational stability lens time .
DOC.brief_title: Visual Function After Implantation Bilateral AcrySof® Toric Natural Intraocular Lens
DOC.criteria: Are candidate bilateral implantation In good general ocular health , 21 year age old , either gender race , diagnose agerelated cataract eye In need spherical correction 10.0 Diopter ( D ) 30.0 D Preoperative regular corneal astigmatism , ≥ 1.0 D ≤ 2.5 D , measure keratometry Willing able complete require postoperative visit Able comprehend sign statement inform consent Pupil dilation ≥ 6.0 mm Expected achieve postoperative logMAR +0.3 well visual acuity ( assessed one following : fundus examination , pinhole visual acuity , and/or PAM evaluation ) ; Exclusion Criteria Before Surgery Ocular Previous cataract patient without potential bilateral implantation Females child bear potential Irregular corneal astigmatism Keratopathy/Keratectasia corneal abnormality include limited following : keratoconus , keratoglobus , keratolysis , keratomalacia , keratomycosis , cornea plana Any inflammation edema ( swell ) cornea , include limited following : keratitis , keratoconjunctivitis , keratouveitis Previous corneal reshaping , include limited following : keratomileusis , radial keratotomy ( RK ) , photorefractive keratectomy ( PRK ) , Laser Situ Keratomileusis ( LASIK ) , Thermal Keratoplasty ( TK ) , Penetrating Keratoplasty ( PK ) Clinically significant corneal dystrophy ( include Fuch 's dystrophy ) Previous corneal transplant Amblyopia Glaucoma ( medically uncontrolled ) Clinically significant RPE/Macular change Proliferative diabetic retinopathy History macular edema Previous history retinal detachment History uveitis/iritis Extremely shallow anterior chamber , due swell cataract Iris neovascularization Microphthalmos Absent eye eye light perception ( NLP ) fellow eye Rubella , congenital , traumatic , complicate cataract Optic atrophy Exclusion Criteria During Surgery Other procedure surgery Limbal relaxing incision ( LRIs ) procedure reduce amount preoperative astigmatism study eye ( ) , whether implant SA60TT SA60AT , duration study
